result.execSummary:
The defendant Royal Edward Summers III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: COURT ORDERED Defendant to pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees, if applicable, to be paid on or before 04-01-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 day TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Royal Edward Summers III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 1 DAY in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 day TIME SERVED.  
COURT ORDERED Defendant to pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees, if applicable, to be paid on or before 04-01-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

ADDRESS INFO for Royal Edward Summers III
Current: 2243 North 44th Street, Apt. 101, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 10-01-2015)
Prior: 2243 North 44th Street #101, Milwaukee, WI 53201

Defendant Royal Edward Summers in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTYy.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Defendant Royal Edward Summers in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Morgan Wilz, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Marnetta D. B. D.O.B. 7/31/1971 2527 S. 13th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215 and A.N.C. D.O.B. 11/12/2007.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Royal Edward Summers in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Royal Edward Summers in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
